==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|alt=𠊊}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}}: a mouth over a bowl of rice on a stand. While the current form is {{zh-l|*人}}+{{zh-l|*良}}, the lower part (bowl of rice on a stand) is cognate to {{zh-l|*皀}}, not to {{zh-l|*良}} or {{zh-l|*艮}}. This is more visible in the form {{zh-l|*𠊊}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'': {{Han compound|亼|皀|c1=p|c2=s|ls=psc}}; see {{zh-l|*𠊊}}.

===Etymology 1===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m/s/g-ljak}}.

=====Usage notes=====
* Cantonese, Hakka, and Min regularly uses {{lang|zh|食}} to mean “to eat”, whereas Mandarin uses {{zh-l|吃}}.
* Mandarin uses {{zh-l|吸}} for “to smoke”.

=====Usage notes=====
This character has a simplified form of [[飠]] when used to compose larger characters, as seen in [[飲]]. This character is not simplified when used as itself. It can also appear in an alternative form as in [[餡]].

===Etymology 1===
Unbound apophonic form uke.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うか}}

# food
# grain

===Etymology 2===
uka + i → uke<sub>2</sub> → uke. Bound apophonic form {{m|ja|食|tr=uka}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うけ}}

# food

===Etymology 3===
Cognate with {{m|ja|笥|tr=ke}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|け}}

# food

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|し}}

# food

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しょく}}

# a [[meal]]
# [[foodstuff]]
# an [[eclipse]]
